# Loading the Package
First, we need to load the SimpLin package into our R session.

```{r}
library(SimpLin)
```

# Simulating Data
Next, let's create some sample data to model. 

```{r}
set.seed(600) 

n <- 20
x_vals <- runif(n, 0, 50)
y_vals <- 10 + 3 * x_vals + rnorm(n, 0, 15)
```

# Fitting the Model
Now we can use the main function of our package, SimpLin(), to fit a regression model to our simulated data.

```{r}
model_fit <- SimpLin(x = x_vals, y = y_vals)
```

# Viewing the Results
The model_fit object is a list containing all the key outputs from our regression analysis. We can inspect each component.

```{r}
print(model_fit)
```
